meanings.sent1: The whin in the garden has bright yellow flowers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful whin blooming by the roadside.
meanings.sent3: The whin in the park adds a splash of color to the surroundings.
meanings.sent4: The whin stood out like a golden beacon among the greenery.
meanings.sent5: The whin's yellow blossoms are like drops of sunshine.

meanings.sent1: Stop your whining and do your chores.
meanings.sent2: She tends to whin when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The cat began to whin when it realized its food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent4: He would whin about the smallest inconveniences.
meanings.sent5: The child's constant whining grated on everyone's nerves.

meanings.sent1: The whin of the engine signaled a problem.
meanings.sent2: The constant whin of the mosquito kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: The eerie whin echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent4: The whin of the wind outside made the house feel lonely.
meanings.sent5: The distant whin of a siren broke the silence of the night.
